Sri Aurobindo was also a journalist, editing newspapers such as Vande Mataram. Sri Aurobindo joined the Indian movement for independence from British colonial rule, until 1910 was one of the Indian movement for independence from British colonial rule's influential leaders, and then became a spiritual reformer, introducing Sri Aurobindo's visions on human progress and spiritual evolution.Sri Aurobindo studied for the Indian Civil Service at King's College, in Cambridge, England. After returning to India Sri Aurobindo took up various civil service works under the Maharaja of the Princely state of Baroda and became increasingly involved in nationalist politics in the Indian National Congress and the nascent revolutionary movement in Bengal with the Anushilan Samiti. Sri Aurobindo was arrested in the aftermath of a number of bombings linked to the nascent revolutionary movement in Bengal with the Anushilan Samiti in a public trial where he faced charges of treason for Alipore Conspiracy. However, Sri Aurobindo could only be convicted and imprisoned for writing articles against British colonial rule in India. Sri Aurobindo was released when no evidence could be provided, following the murder of a prosecution witness, Narendranath Goswami, during a public trial where he faced charges of treason for Alipore Conspiracy. During Sri Aurobindo's stay in the jail, Sri Aurobindo had mystical and spiritual experiences, after which Sri Aurobindo moved to Pondicherry, leaving politics for spiritual work.At Pondicherry, Sri Aurobindo developed a spiritual practice Sri Aurobindo called Integral Yoga. The central theme of Sri Aurobindo's vision was the evolution of human life into a divine life in divine body. Sri Aurobindo believed in a spiritual realisation that not only liberated but transformed human nature, enabling a divine life on earth. In 1926, with the help of Sri Aurobindo's spiritual collaborator, Mirra Alfassa (referred to as "The Mother"), Sri Aurobindo Ashram was founded.Sri Aurobindo's main literary works are The Life Divine, which deals with the philosophical aspect of Integral Yoga; Synthesis of Yoga, which deals with the principles and methods of Integral Yoga; and Savitri: A Legend and a Symbol, an epic poem.
